newsitem.title: USA: TVA board approves 5.5 pct rate increase.
newsitem.headline: TVA board approves 5.5 pct rate increase.

text.p: The Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) said directors voted unanimously Tuesday to approve a price increase that will generate a 5.5 percent increase in revenue.

Stating the increase is an effort to reduce the federal corporation's debt, TVA said it will generate about $325 million in revenue a year. When combined with other actions to cut costs and improve operations, this is expected to cut the $27.6 billion debt in half by 2007.
The increase, which is effective Oct. 1, is the first for TVA since 1987.
"This ambitious, comprehensive financial plan is the capstone of our four-year effort to prepare TVA for deregulation," said TVA Chairman Craven Crowell at a board meeting in Chattanooga.
Crowell called the price increase "the best business decision for TVA." He said implementing recommendations in the financial plan will "preserve TVA as a national asset."
TVA said it is the nation's largest producer of electricity, and noted its power system is self-financed.
